lexUnit.name: gratified.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with pleasure and satisfaction

sentence.text: I was gratified to see the coverage in May 's issue on musical instruments .
She must have been gratified to hear from a famous person like himself .
He was gratified to see the shock in Gazzer 's eyes .
In the shopping centre , I was gratified to see my name up on the Day 's Attractions board , and I sat down at a prepared place by the side of the stage .

Joanna Murchison , always a frail woman , was currently suffering a bout of unseasonal influenza.a However , Julie was gratified to see the remarkable change in her Mother 's general health since she had arrived home .
I was gratified to have your letter , as I had been wondering how you were faring , but understood that you must be too busy to write .
The character can meet the change head on , in which case we may feel gratified -- or sidestep the new knowledge , try to behave as though everything is the same as before .
Does he feel gratified , or like a grand-daddy ?
` Always knew you were one of me mates , " said Archie , highly gratified that things had suddenly been made easy for him .
A gratified chairman of the England Committee registers his pleasure at the result and for the facts that good sportsmanship prevailed and England fielded some young players successfully .
After the British general election of 1987 the Alliance would no doubt have been gratified to find itself under-represented to a degree no greater than that .
Her voice had taken on a husky , girlish tone and he was gratified .
` I 'm gratified to find you so concerned for my welfare , Li Yuan .
She saw Tom 's brow clear and was absurdly gratified to find that her advice was of some use to him .
I am immensely gratified that those who participate in the activities of co-operation between the RUC and Garda Siochana say that the quality of co-operation is at its highest point for 30 years .

They have been over the greater part of Van Diemen 's Land and the Islands in Bass 's Straits and appear highly gratified with their peregrinations : a government vessel has generally been devoted to their use .
We were really gratified , and the chapel has given much pleasure .
